page.title: 08BUXTON C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: The village school at Buxton was founded as a{Charity Poor School}in 1796 by a local{Quaker}farmer named John Wright. He was an uncle of{Anna Sewell}the author of the literary classic 'Black Beauty'. The present building, dating from 1833, contains 7 classrooms, one hall, a kitchen and administrative offices. In the 1960's the Education Committee bought the redundant railway station buildings and converted them into a classroom and caretaker's house. The school has a Headteacher, a Deputy Headteacher, seven other teaching staff, a secretary/welfare assistant, three cooks,four lunchtime_supervisory assistants, three cleaners and 192 children. The age range of the children is from 5 to 11 years of age.
